active_or_passive_rules.name: Warlord of Carn Dum
active_or_passive_rules.description: Friendly Carn Dum models within 6" of Aldrac must re-roll failed Courage Tests.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Battle Frenzy
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Aldrac slays an enemy model that he was Engaged in Combat with, then in the following turn Aldrac may declare a Heroic Combat for free.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Remnants of Arnor
active_or_passive_rules.description: Friendly Dunedain models treat Aranarth as a banner. Additionally, all Dunedain models in the same Army List as Aranarth gain the Arnor Keyword.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Chieftain of the Dunedain
active_or_passive_rules.description: Friendly Dunedain Hero models may benefit from Arathorn's Stand Fast.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The King in the North
active_or_passive_rules.description: The range of Arvedui's Stand Fast is 12", rather than 6"

active_or_passive_rules.name: Lead by Example
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Buhrdur slays an enemy Hero or Monster in Combat, then for the rest of the game other friendly Orc or Troll models treat Buhrdur as a banner. If Buhrdur has slain 3 or more enemy Hero or Monster models, then for the rest of the game other friendly Orc or Troll models treat Buhrdur as a banner with a range of 6" instead.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Brutish Cunning
active_or_passive_rules.description: This model may re-roll a single D6 in a Duel Roll when fighting solely against Infantry models (but not Monster models).

active_or_passive_rules.name: Glory Seekers
active_or_passive_rules.description: If this model is Engaged in Combat with an enemy Hero, then this model gains a bonus of +1 To Wound that Hero when making Strikes.

active_or_passive_rules.name: A Fool's Challenge
active_or_passive_rules.description: Earnur must always Charge an enemy Hero if he able to do so when he Activates. Additionally, he may never decline a Heroic Challenge under any circumstances.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Master Duellist
active_or_passive_rules.description: At the start of a Combat involving Earnur, before Heroic Strikes are resolved, Earnur may increase his Fight value to match that of a single enemy he is Engaged in Combat with. Additionally, Earnur can never have his Fight Value modified by enemy special rules or Magical Powers.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Incantations of Power
active_or_passive_rules.description:
After rolling for Priority, Fraecht can spend a point of Will to have one of the following incantations take effect for the rest of the turn.
Strength - Friendly Carn Dum models within 6" of Fraecht must re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes.
Endurance - Whenever a Friendly Carn Dum model within 6" of Fraecht suffers a Wound, roll a D6. On a 5+, that Wound is ignored.
Swiftness - Friendly Carn Dum models that start their move within 6" of Fraecht are not slowed by difficult terrain (except for water features).

active_or_passive_rules.name: Armour of Gondolin
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst Glorfindel is wearing the Armour of Gondolin, enemy Monster models Engaged in Combat with him cannot use Brutal Power Attacks.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Hero of the Elves
active_or_passive_rules.description: Glorfindel gains a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes against Monster models.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Lord of the West
active_or_passive_rules.description: This model may re-roll a single D6 when making a Duel Roll. Additionally, they may re-roll a single D6 when rolling To Wound when making Strikes.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Strength of Body, Strength of Will
active_or_passive_rules.description: Gulavhar's Attacks are always equal to its remaining Wounds. Additionally, for each Wound Gulavhar has lost, worsen Gulavhar's Courage value by 1 (this will improve again should Gulavhar regain a lost Wound via the Immortal Hunger special rule below).

active_or_passive_rules.name: Immortal Hunger
active_or_passive_rules.description: Each time Gulavhar slays a model in Combat, it regains a single Wound lost earlier in the battle. These Wounds are regained at the end of the Combat. Gulavhar can only regain Wounds in this way by making Strikes, never by using a Brutal Power Attack.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Banner of Arwen Evenstar
active_or_passive_rules.description: This is a banner with a range of 6" rather than 3", and Halbarad never suffers the -1 penalty to his Duel Rolls for carrying a banner. Additionally, friendly models within 6" and Line of Sight of the Banner of Arwen Evenstar automatically pass any Courage Tests they are required to take.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Brutish Cunning
active_or_passive_rules.description: This model may re-roll a single D6 in a Duel Roll when fighting solely against Infantry models (but not Monster models).

active_or_passive_rules.name: Gift of Foresight
active_or_passive_rules.description: Every time a friendly Arnor model suffers a Wound within 6" and Line of Sight of Malbeth, roll a D6. On a 5+, the Wound is prevented. If failed, Hero models may still use Fate points as normal.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Foresight of the Eldar
active_or_passive_rules.description: At the start of the game, before either side deploys, roll a D6 and make a note of the result - this is the number of Foresight Points that Malbeth has for the battle. During the roll for Priority, so long as he is alive and on the battlefield, Malbeth can spend these Foresight Points to increase the roll on his controlling player's roll for Priority. For each Foresight Point spent, increase the dice roll by 1, to a maximum of 6.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Scavenge
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whenever Nazthak slays an enemy model in Combat (with the exception of Monster models), he may choose to scavenge a single piece of wargear carried by that model, with the exception of a Mount, another type of armour, living creatures, the One Ring, or items of wargear that are integral to the model (such as claws and teeth). This will happen before any effects that allow the slain model to pass on that piece of wargear. Add the scavenged item to Nazthak's list of wargear. Nazthak will benefit from the scavenged wargear as if he was the original model. Nazthak may choose to discard any piece of scavenged wargear at any time, though if he does so then he cannot reclaim it - it is lost.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Conduit of Angmar
active_or_passive_rules.description: If a Ringwraith model is within 6" of a friendly Shade, they may use the Shade to determine range and Line of Sight for a Magical Power. Additionally, after making a Casting Roll within 6" of a friendly Shade, a Ringwraith can choose to deal a single Wound to the Shade to add 1 to the Casting Roll.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Swirling Mists
active_or_passive_rules.description: At the start of the Shoot Phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions step, a Shade may spend a Will Point to use this ability. If it does, then for the remainder of the turn, enemy models will suffer a -1 penalty To Hit when making a shooting attack that targets a friendly model within 6" of the Shade. If the enemy model making the shooting attack is also within 12" of the Shade, they will suffer a -2 penalty To Hit instead

active_or_passive_rules.name: Ghostly Resolve
active_or_passive_rules.description: Friendly Angmar Orc models within 12" of one or more models with this special rule gain a bonus of +1 to any Courage Tests they are required to take.

wargear: An amalgamation of grasping spectral hands (hand weapons)

active_or_passive_rules.name: Herald of Doom
active_or_passive_rules.description: At the beginning of the game, after both sides have been deployed, choose one Hero model in your opponent's Army. Whilst the Shadow of Rhudaur is within 6" of the chosen Hero, that Hero suffers a -1 penalty to their Fate Rolls and a -1 penalty to any Courage Tests they are required to take.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Powers of Angmar
active_or_passive_rules.description: If the Shadow of Rhudaur rolls a natural 6 when making a Casting Roll, then the target model cannot spend Will Points to attempt to Resist the Magical Power.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Glory Seekers
active_or_passive_rules.description: If this model is Engaged in Combat with an enemy Hero, then this model gains a bonus of +1 To Wound that Hero when making Strikes.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Feral Charge
active_or_passive_rules.description: When a Werewolf Charges an enemy Infantry model, they gain the Knock to the Ground bonus as if they were Cavalry. This bonus is lost if they are subsequently charged by an enemy Cavalry model.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Packlord
active_or_passive_rules.description: Friendly models may not benefit from the Heroic Actions or Stand Fast of this model unless they have the Warg keyword.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Packlord
active_or_passive_rules.description: Friendly models may not benefit from the Heroic Actions or Stand Fast of this model unless they have the Warg keyword.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Family Bond
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst within 3" of Sigrid or Tilda, Bain increases his Attacks to 2, and gains a bonus of +1 to his Courage tests.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Da! Down here!
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst within 6" of Sigrid or Tilda, Bard the Bowman gains a bonus of +1 to his Fight Value. If Bard the Bowman is within 6" of both Sigrid and Tilda, then he will gain a bonus of +1 to his Fight Value and may re-roll a single D6 when making a Duel Roll. Additionally, during the Declare Heroic Actions Step of the Fight Phase, if Sigrid or Tilda are within 6" of Bard and are Engaged in Combat, then Bard may declare a Heroic Combat for free. If this Heroic Combat is successful, then Bard must use the following Move to join Sigrid's or Tilda's Combat. If this is not possible, then Bard must move as close as possible to Sigrid or Tilda. Bard cannot use this special rule whilst he is in the same Combat as either Sigrid or Tilda, unless the other one of Sigrid or Tilda is in a different Combat within 6".

active_or_passive_rules.name: Da! Down here!
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst within 6" of Sigrid or Tilda, Bard the Bowman gains a bonus of +1 to his Fight Value. If Bard the Bowman is within 6" of both Sigrid and Tilda, then he will gain a bonus of +1 to his Fight Value and may re-roll a single D6 when making a Duel Roll. Additionally, during the Declare Heroic Actions Step of the Fight Phase, if Sigrid or Tilda are within 6" of Bard and are Engaged in Combat, then Bard may declare a Heroic Combat for free. If this Heroic Combat is successful, then Bard must use the following Move to join Sigrid's or Tilda's Combat. If this is not possible, then Bard must move as close as possible to Sigrid or Tilda. Bard cannot use this special rule whilst he is in the same Combat as either Sigrid or Tilda, unless the other one of Sigrid or Tilda is in a different Combat within 6".

additional_text: If any member of Bard's Family is slain, Bard must always Charge any enemy that killed one of his children if he able to do so for the rest of the game. If he is in range of multiple enemy targets that he must Charge, then the controlling player may choose one of them.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Onwards Men of Esgaroth
active_or_passive_rules.description: Lake-town Militia that are within 3" of a friendly Lake-town Hero model who is Engaged in Combat automatically pass any Courage tests they are required to make for being in a Broken army.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Dubious Counsel
active_or_passive_rules.description:
At the start of his Activation, Alfrid may choose a single other friendly Lake-town Hero model within 6" of him. Roll a D6 and consult the table below to see what effect Alfrid's counsel has had. Alfrid may spend his Will Points to alter the score on the D6 either up or down by 1 for each Will Point spent in this manner.
1. The chosen Hero loses a Might Point and Alfrid gains a Might Point. If the chosen Hero has no Might Points remaining, this has no effect.
2. The chosen Hero immediately regains a single Will Point spent earlier in the battle.
3. The chosen Hero may re-roll To Wound Rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes until the end of the turn.
4. The chosen Hero gains the Fearless special rule until the end of the turn.
5. The chosen Hero increases their Fight Value by 1 until the end of the turn.
6. The chosen Hero immediately regains a single Might Point spent earlier in the battle.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Rapid Fire
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Bard hits a target with his great bow, he may make another shooting attack with his great bow that targets a model within 3" of the initial target - it may even be the same target. If that second shot also hits, then Bard may Shoot again as described above. Bard can make a maximum of three shots per turn as a result of this special rule.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Swift Shot
active_or_passive_rules.description: Never suffers -1 penalty for moving and shooting.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Black Arrow
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Bard takes the Windlance, then once per game Bard can fire the Black Arrow. If he does, declare this before rolling To Hit. Bard may re-roll any failed To Hit and In The Way rolls. Furthermore, do not roll on the Scatter Table- a successful To Hit Roll against a Battlefield Target will always count as a Dead On result.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Windlance Trained
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Bard takes a Windlance, he will be the only crew. but can move more than 6" away, and rotate it without any penalty. Windlance attacks against Monster models gain a +1 bonus to any rolls on the Scatter Table.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Mithril Coat
active_or_passive_rules.description: A piece of Mithril armour, additionally Bilbo may re-roll Fate rolls of a 1.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Sting
active_or_passive_rules.description: An Elven hand weapon, Bilbo gains +1 Strength when making strikes with Sting.

active_or_passive_rules.name: It has not yet Awoken
active_or_passive_rules.description: Bilbo ignores the Sauron's Will section of the rules for the One Ring. Furthermore, if Bilbo is the only model left on his controlling player's side, and is wearing the One Ring, he is not removed as a casualty as would usually be the case.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Master's Puppet
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst within 6" and Line of Sight of the Master of Lake-town, Braga automatically passes all Courage Tests he is required to take and may re-roll all failed To Wound Rolls when making Strikes. This special rule has no effect if the Master of Lake-town has no Will Points remaining.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Captain of the Guard
active_or_passive_rules.description: So long as Braga has Will points remaining, friendly Lake-town Guard Captains and Lake-town Guard within 3" of him count as having Dominant (2).

active_or_passive_rules.name: Windlance Trained
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Girion takes a Windlance, he will be the only crew, but can move more than 6" away, and rotate it without any penalty. Windlance attacks against Monster models gain a +1 bonus to any rolls on the Scatter Table.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Lord of Dale
active_or_passive_rules.description: Girion's Stand Fast is 12", and friendly Dale models within 3" of him may re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes.

active_or_passive_rules.name: "Stand by our Men!"
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Hilda-Bianca Charges into Combat, then during the ensuing Fight phase, she and friendly Lake-town models within 3" of her gain a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Everyone has a Price
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst within 6" and Line of Sight of the Master of Lake-town, this model may re-roll failed To Wound rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes. This rule has no effect if the Master of Lake-town has no Will points remaining.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Everyone has a Price
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst within 6" and Line of Sight of the Master of Lake-town, this model may re-roll failed To Wound rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes. This rule has no effect if the Master of Lake-town has no Will points remaining.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Archers, This Way!
active_or_passive_rules.description: friendly Lake-town models within 6" and in Line of Sight of Percy may re-roll To Hit results of a 1, when making shooting attacks.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Moneybags
active_or_passive_rules.description: At the start of the Fight Phase, before the declare Heroic Actions Step, the Master of Lake-town may spend a Will Point to use this special rule. If he does, then Braga, Captain of the Guard, and any friendly Lake-town Guard Captains and Lake-town Guard within 6" of the Master of Lake-town gain a bonus of +1 to their Fight Value and treat the Master of Lake-town as a banner until the end of the turn.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Price of Greed
active_or_passive_rules.description: At the beginning of the game, your opponent must choose one of their Hero models to be the bearer of a large sum of gold. If the chosen Hero model Moves into base contact with the Master of Lake-town, then the Master of Lake-town must immediately take a Courage Test. If the test is failed, then the Master of Lake-town immediately flees and is removed as a casualty.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Save the Gold!
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whenever an enemy Hero model within 3" of the Master of Lake-town is removed as a casualty, the Master of Lake-town immediately regains a single Will Point spent earlier in the battle. Additionally, if the Master of Lake-town is in base contact with an Objective Marker during the End Phase of a turn, he may regain a single Will Point spent earlier in the battle.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Acurate
active_or_passive_rules.description: A Windlance will only scatter 3" rather than 6"

active_or_passive_rules.name: Piercing Shot
active_or_passive_rules.description: A model hit will be flung back D3" if it has a Strength of 5 or lower. Any models passed over are knocked prone and take a Strength 5 hit. The flung model stops if it hits impassable terrain or a model with Strength 6 or higher, and both take a Strength 6 hit. The flung model is knocked prone if it survives. If the flung model would end its movement over other models, those models are moved the minimum distance to allow the flung model to be placed.

additional_text: Crewed by two Dale Siege Crew, one of which is the Siege Veteran.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Wall of Blades
active_or_passive_rules.description: This model gains a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes with their spear against a model that Charged them this turn.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Lord of Dale
active_or_passive_rules.description: Brand's Stand Fast! Is 12" rather than 6".

active_or_passive_rules.name: Stoic Fighter
active_or_passive_rules.description: At the start of any Combat involving Brand, if he would be Trapped upon losing the Duel roll, he may re-roll a single D6 in the Duel roll, and a single D6 when rolling To Wound.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Banner of Arwen Evenstar
active_or_passive_rules.description: A banner with a range of 6", and Halbarad does not suffer the usual -1 penalty in Duel rolls. Additionally, friendly models within 6" and in Line of Sight of the banner automatically pass any Courage Tests they are required to take.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Wall of Blades
active_or_passive_rules.description: This model gains a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes with their spear against a model that Charged them this turn.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Stone flail
active_or_passive_rules.description: Two-handed weapon. If Azog uses this in a Combat, he gains Mighty Blow and reduces his Fight value to 6 for that Combat, even after a Heroic Strike. Any model struck by it and not slain is knocked Prone at the end of the combat.

active_or_passive_rules.name: General of the North
active_or_passive_rules.description: Azog's Stand Fast has a range of 12", and also affects friendly Orc Hero models.

active_or_passive_rules.name: I am the Master
active_or_passive_rules.description: When making Strikes against an enemy Hero, he may use this rule. A To Wound roll of a natural 3+ will always count as successful, regardless of the Hero's Defence.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Bringer of Death
active_or_passive_rules.description: Keep track of how many enemies that Bolg kills in Combat. After two kills, Bolg gains Terror. After five kills, Bolg gains Harbinger of Evil (12"). After eight kills, Bolg gains Mighty Hero.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Catapult
active_or_passive_rules.description: A Siege Engine with range 12" - 96" and Strength 10. May still fire in same turn the troll has Moved, but will only hit on the roll of a natural 6. May still fire while Engaged in Combat, but on a To Hit roll of a natural 1, the troll suffers a Wound. Does not have a normal siege crew, and can always be fired if the troll is alive. Other models can never fire this catapult as Untrained Crew. The catapult cannot be destroyed as normal if an enemy spends an entire turn in base contact.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Area Effect
active_or_passive_rules.description: After rolling To Hit against a Battlefield Target, all other models within 2" of them suffer a Strength 5 and will be knocked Prone.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Goblin Crew
active_or_passive_rules.description: If the troll wins a Combat, then after making Strikes, the Goblins may make D6 additional strikes with Strength 3. If the troll uses a Brutal Power Attack that ends the Combat, then the Goblins will not get these additional Strikes.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Metal Gauntlets
active_or_passive_rules.description: Any Strikes made by the model are resolved as Strength 10. Also, this model may re-roll the dice when determining the Hurl Distance when using Hurl Brutal Power Attack.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Hunt Master
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst he has the Cavalry keyword, Fimbul does not suffer any penalties for Moving through Difficult Terrain, and therefore may still gain bonuses for Charging. Also, whilst he has the Cavalry keyword, Fimbul gains +1 to his Fight value on a turn in which he Charges.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Chittering Hordes
active_or_passive_rules.description: This model can support other models who also have the Chittering Hordes rule, as if they had a spear. Supporting models cannot use a two-handed weapon in the same Combat.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Mercenary Ambush
active_or_passive_rules.description: Warbands lead by a Goblin Mercenary Captain that contain solely Goblin Mercenaries do not have to deploy at the start of the game, as they may be kept in reserve. If you choose to do so, then from turn 2 onwards, the Captain must take an Intelligence test at the end of each of the controlling player's Activation phases. If passed, the player decides whether the warband arrives. If failed, the opposing player decides. If they arrive, they should be fully placed within a terrain piece that the entire warband can hide within or behind. They cannot be placed in enemy Control Zones, cannot Move that turn, but may otherwise act normally. If the Mercenaries cannot be placed as described above, then they may arrive from any board edge via the rules for Reinforcements.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Chittering Hordes
active_or_passive_rules.description: This model can support other models who also have the Chittering Hordes rule, as if they had a spear. Supporting models cannot use a two-handed weapon in the same Combat.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Mercenary Ambush
active_or_passive_rules.description: Warbands lead by a Goblin Mercenary Captain that contain solely Goblin Mercenaries do not have to deploy at the start of the game, as they may be kept in reserve. If you choose to do so, then from turn 2 onwards, the Captain must take an Intelligence test at the end of each of the controlling player's Activation phases. If passed, the player decides whether the warband arrives. If failed, the opposing player decides. If they arrive, they should be fully placed within a terrain piece that the entire warband can hide within or behind. They cannot be placed in enemy Control Zones, cannot Move that turn, but may otherwise act normally. If the Mercenaries cannot be placed as described above, then they may arrive from any board edge via the rules for Reinforcements.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Oblivious to Pain
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whenever this model suffers a Wound, roll a D6. On the roll of a natural 6, the Wound is ignored.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Relentless Advance
active_or_passive_rules.description: Ogres can pass through friendly Orc, Goblin and Bat models when they Charge into Combat, but not when forced to Move from Magical Powers or special rules. Each model they pass through suffers a Strength 3 hit. Any model that the Ogre ends their move on is automatically slain.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Crushing Club
active_or_passive_rules.description: Any strikes made with this weapon count as having the Mighty Blow special rule. Also, any model struck by this weapon and not slain must roll a D6 at the end of the Combat. On a 3+, that model is immediately knocked Prone.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Scythe Gauntlets
active_or_passive_rules.description: A Gundabad Troll armed with Scythe Gauntlets increases its Attacks to 4.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Savage Hunters
active_or_passive_rules.description: This model gains a bonus of +1 Attacks on a turn in which it Charges.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Savage Hunters
active_or_passive_rules.description: This model gains a bonus of +1 Attacks on a turn in which it Charges.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Savage Hunters
active_or_passive_rules.description: This model gains a bonus of +1 Attacks on a turn in which it Charges.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Rhunish Fury
active_or_passive_rules.description: Khamul has 3 Attacks instead of 2.

active_or_passive_rules.name: One of Nine
active_or_passive_rules.description: Maximum of nine Nazgul models in your Army. Hero models wearing the One Ring are not invisible to these models.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Unholy Resurrection
active_or_passive_rules.description: When slain, place a marker where this model was killed. Models may not overlap these markers for any reason. During the Priority phase of each turn, after Priority has been determined, roll a D6. On a 3+, remove the marker and immediately place this model anywhere within 3" of the marker, but not in base contact with it. If this is not possible, place the model where the marker was. On a 1-2, the model is slain and the marker is removed. The Necromancer can use his Will points to improve this roll, as long as the Nazgul are in range of the Necromancer's Master of the Nazgul special rule. Whilst the marker is in play, this model counts as being on the board for the purpose of determining if your army is Broken or reduced to 25%. However, a marker cannot hold objectives, and this model still counts as being slain for any special rules that come into effect when a model is slain, such as a Heroic Combat. If this model is slain by a Magical Power or an Elven weapon, they suffer a -1 penalty to their roll. When the game ends, any markers still on the board are removed and the associated models will be counted as casualties.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Spider Webs
active_or_passive_rules.description: A Mirkwood Spider can shoot webs, treated as a throwing weapon with a range of 8". If the spider hits its target, do not roll To Wound. Instead, the model suffers the effects of the Paralyse Magical Power, however the effects will not immediately end should this model have no Will points or be slain. If this hits a Cavalry model, both the rider and mount will be hit. A Hero model hit may spend a Fat point to avoid its effects If the Hero is a Cavalry model, this would negate the effects on both the rider and mount.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Silent Hunters
active_or_passive_rules.description: If a Mirkwood Hunting Spider is within a piece of woodland terrain, such as a forest, or is partially concealed by a piece of woodland terrain, then they cannot be seen by enemy models unless they are within 6" of the Mirkwood Hunting Spider.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Lethal Aim
active_or_passive_rules.description: Each Turn, Narzug gains a free Might point that can only be spent during a shooting attack on either the To Hit, To Wound or In The Way roll. If this point is not spent by the end of the turn, it is lost.

active_or_passive_rules.name: He cannot yet take Physical Form
active_or_passive_rules.description: The Necromancer may use Will points as Fate points.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Drain Soul
active_or_passive_rules.description: Any model that suffers a Wound from the Necromancer in Combat, and is not prevented, will be automatically slain.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Master of the Nazgul
active_or_passive_rules.description: Any friendly Nazgul of Dol Guldur in your Army gains a +1 bonus to rolls for their Unholy Resurrection rule, depending on if they are in range of the Necromancer. If he has 20+ Will points remaining, the range of this rule is 18". For between 10 and 19 Will points, the range is 12". For 9 or less Will points, the range is 6".

active_or_passive_rules.name: Spiritual Displacement
active_or_passive_rules.description: You may include up to two Abyssal Knights. At the start of the Move phase before the Declare Heroic Actions step, the controlling player may remove one of the Abyssal Knights and place them anywhere within 3" of the other Abyssal Knight. It may not be placed in base contact with an enemy, and does not count as Moving. Only one Abyssal Knight may use this special rule per turn.

active_or_passive_rules.name: One of Nine
active_or_passive_rules.description: Maximum of nine Nazgul models in your Army. Hero models wearing the One Ring are not invisible to these models.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Unholy Resurrection
active_or_passive_rules.description: When slain, place a marker where this model was killed. Models may not overlap these markers for any reason. During the Priority phase of each turn, after Priority has been determined, roll a D6. On a 3+, remove the marker and immediately place this model anywhere within 3" of the marker, but not in base contact with it. If this is not possible, place the model where the marker was. On a 1-2, the model is slain and the marker is removed. The Necromancer can use his Will points to improve this roll, as long as the Nazgul are in range of the Necromancer's Master of the Nazgul special rule. Whilst the marker is in play, this model counts as being on the board for the purpose of determining if your army is Broken or reduced to 25%. However, a marker cannot hold objectives, and this model still counts as being slain for any special rules that come into effect when a model is slain, such as a Heroic Combat. If this model is slain by a Magical Power or an Elven weapon, they suffer a -1 penalty to their roll. When the game ends, any markers still on the board are removed and the associated models will be counted as casualties.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Executioner
active_or_passive_rules.description: If this model rolls a natural 6 during a Duel roll, then it gains Mighty Blow for any Strikes it makes during that Combat.

active_or_passive_rules.name: "You have something my Master wants!"
active_or_passive_rules.description: The Keeper of the Dungeons gains a +1 bonus To Wound when making Strikes against any model carrying a ring of power - Nenya, Narya or Vilya, the Ring of Durin, or the One Ring.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Unnatural Speed
active_or_passive_rules.description: At the start of the Move phase before the Declare Heroic Actions step, the controlling player may remove this model and place them anywhere within 3" of where they were. It may not be placed in base contact with an enemy, and does not count as Moving.

active_or_passive_rules.description: When a Troll Brute Tramples, it will inflict 2 Strength 10 hits.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Piercing Talons
active_or_passive_rules.description: This model gains a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes in a turn in which it Charges.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Pluck
active_or_passive_rules.description: If this model Charges into Combat, choose a single enemy model on a 25mm base that the War Bat Moved over and roll a D6. On a 4+, the chosen model is immediately knocked Prone.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Price of Failure
active_or_passive_rules.description: At the beginning of a Combat he is involved in, if Yazneg is within 3" of Azog, he can declare this rule before the Duel roll is made. If he does so, then Yazneg may re-roll any number of dice during the Duel roll. However, if he uses this rule and fails to win the Duel roll, then he immediately suffers a single Wound.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Sting
active_or_passive_rules.description: Elven hand weapon. Bilbo gains a bonus of +1 to his Strength when making Strikes with Sting.

active_or_passive_rules.name: It has not yet Awoken
active_or_passive_rules.description: Bilbo ignores Sauron's Will section of the One Ring rules. If Bilbo if the only model left on his side, he is not removed as a casualty if he is wearing the Ring.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Glamdring
active_or_passive_rules.description: Elven hand-and-a-half weapon. Gandalf's strength is 5 when making strikes with Glamdring.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Narya

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Old Twirly Whirlies
active_or_passive_rules.description: This ballista always counts as declaring a Heroic Shoot each Shoot phase for free. When a target is hit, draw 1mm line between centre of the Ballista and the target's base. For that turn, any shooting attacks of Strength 6 or lower cannot be made if they cross that line, or if the shooting target is within 3" of the line. Similarly in both cases, shooting attacks above Strength 6 must roll a D6. On a 5+, the shot is prevented.

active_or_passive_rules.description: If Thorin uses Shielding in a Combat and wins, he may make a single Strength 4 Strike against one enemy involved in the Combat.

active_or_passive_rules.name: "Loyalty, honour, a willing heart. I can ask no more than that"
active_or_passive_rules.description: Friendly Thorin's Company models within 6" of Thorin may re-roll To Wound rolls on a natural 1 when making Strikes. Also, they may benefit from Thorin's Stand Fast.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Durin's Heir
active_or_passive_rules.description: Thrain's Stand Fast has a range of 12" and also affects friendly Dwarf Hero models.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Ring of Durin
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Thrain carries the Ring of Durin, once per game after the Priority roll has taken place, you may re-roll the Priority roll.

additional_text: If your army does not include Thror, Thrain carries the Ring of Durin.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Arkenstone
active_or_passive_rules.description: Thror passes Fate rolls on a 3+, rather than 4+. Also, if the result of a Fate roll is 4+, that roll is free, and does not cost a point of Fate.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Ring of Durin
active_or_passive_rules.description: Once per game, after the Priority roll has taken place, you may re-roll the Priority roll.

additional_text: Any Grim Hammer Warriors upgraded to Guardians of the King in Thror's warband will have a Strength value of 4.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Longbeard
active_or_passive_rules.description: After the Priority roll has taken place, Balin may spend a Will point to enable his controlling player to re-roll their D6 in the Priority roll.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Grasper & Keeper
active_or_passive_rules.description: Hand weapons for which Dwalin gains +1 Attack when using Grasper & Keeper, and any To Wound rolls of a natural 6, and not prevented, will cause 2 Wounds rather than 1.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Weapon Master
active_or_passive_rules.description: Dwalin is never considered Unarmed.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Dwarven Fury
active_or_passive_rules.description: At the start of a Combat, roll a D6. On a 5+, Dwalin may re-roll failed To Wound rolls in that combat. However on a 1, Dwalin reduces his Fight value by D3 before the Duel roll takes place.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Oakenshield
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Thorin uses Shielding in a Combat and wins, he may make a single Strength 4 Strike against one enemy involved in the Combat.

active_or_passive_rules.name: To Arms!
active_or_passive_rules.description: Once per game at the start of his Activation, this rule may be declared. All friendly Erebor models within 3" of Thorin gain +1 Strength until the end of that turn.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Barazantathul
active_or_passive_rules.description: Master-forged two-handed weapon.

active_or_passive_rules.name: King Under the Mountain
active_or_passive_rules.description: Dain's Stand Fast will cover the entire battlefield, regardless of range. Additionally, friendly Erebor Dwarf Hero models may benefit from his Stand Fast.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Venerable
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whenever Dain makes a Jump, Leap or Climb test, he will roll two D6 and choose the lowest result.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Exquisite Mithril Armour
active_or_passive_rules.description: Mithril armour that adds 4 to Durin's Defence rather than the usual 3 (already included in his profile).

active_or_passive_rules.name: Durin's axe
active_or_passive_rules.description: Master-forged two-handed weapon. Durin may re-roll a single D6 when making a Duel roll.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Horn of Zirakzigil
active_or_passive_rules.description: A war horn which also gives Durin the Terror special rule.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Ring of Durin
active_or_passive_rules.description: Once per game during the Priority phase, after both sides have rolled their dice, you can re-roll your side's Priority roll.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Crown of Kings
active_or_passive_rules.description: For each Wound he suffers, roll a D6. On a 6, the Wound is prevented and ignored.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Mountain Fighters
active_or_passive_rules.description: This model gains a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes against a model that is within a piece of difficult terrain, such as a piece of rocky terrain, or a ruin.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Accurate
active_or_passive_rules.description: A Dwarven Ballista will only Scatter 3" rather than 6".

active_or_passive_rules.name: Piercing Shot
active_or_passive_rules.description: A model hit will be flung back D6" if it has a Strength of 5 or lower. Any models passed over are knocked prone and take a Strength 5 hit. The flung model stops if it hits impassable terrain or a model with Strength 6 or higher, and both take a Strength 6 hit. The flung model is knocked prone if it survives. If the flung model would end its  movement over other models, those models are moved the minimum distance to allow the flung model to be placed.

additional_text: Crewed by two Dwarf Siege Crew, one of which is the Siege Veteran.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Torozul
active_or_passive_rules.description: This is a Foe Spear, with the Trollbane special rule. Additionally, Mardin adds +1 when rolling To Wound against Monster models.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Durin's Protector
active_or_passive_rules.description: During the Declare Heroic Actions step of the Fight phase, if Durin is Engaged in Combat within 6" of Mardin, then Mardin may declare a free Heroic Combat. If this is successful, Mardin must use the following Move to join Durin's Combat if able, or move as close as possible to him. Mardin cannot use this special rule if he is in the same Combat as Durin.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Cold-headed
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whenever Thorin declares a Heroic Action, roll a D6. On a 5+, the action is free and no Might points are spent. Additionally, if he declares a Heroic Action and an enemy subsequently declares a Heroic Action as well, Thorin may change the action he has declared.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Iron Shield
active_or_passive_rules.description: A shield that provides +3 Defence to this model rather than the usual +1. Also, this model suffers a –1 penalty to their Duel rolls, unless they are Supported by a model with a Foe Spear.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Foe Spear
active_or_passive_rules.description: A spear, if this model is Supporting a model with an Iron Shield, they gain +1 To Wound when making Strikes against Monster models.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Unsteady nerves
active_or_passive_rules.description: Aldor must always shoot first in the Shoot phase, even before Heroic Shoots are resolved.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Lucky Shot
active_or_passive_rules.description: Aldor must re-roll failed To Hit and To Wound rolls when making a shooting attack.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Guthwine
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Eomer rolls a natural 6 To Wound, he may make an additional To Wound roll against the same target. If the additional roll is a natural 6, it does not benefit from this special rule.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Price of Grief
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Theoden or Eowyn are in the same army, and either are slain, Eomer must re-rolls all failed To Wound rolls for the rest of the game, and he must charge if able to do so.

active_or_passive_rules.name: I Shall Kill You if You Touch Him
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst within 3" of Theoden, Eowyn may re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1. If Theoden is slain, she becomes Fearless, and re-rolls any failed To Wound rolls when striking the model who slew Theoden.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Merry
active_or_passive_rules.description: If taken as an option, Merry becomes a passenger on Eowyn's horse. He will have a shield, be an Independent Hero, and still count towards the army's total models and Break Point. He does not take up a space in Eowyn's warband. Whilst he remains mounted, Eowyn gains Resistant to Magic, Attack 3, and can spend Merry's Might, Will and Fate.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Mutual Respect
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst within 6" of Hera, Frealaf gains the Master of Battle (4+) special rule.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Lord of Harrowdale
active_or_passive_rules.description: Any Warriors of Rohan in Frealaf's warband are upgraded to Warriors of Harrowdale. If they have Line of Sight to Frealaf, these warriors may re-roll failed Intelligence tests and gain Shieldwall.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Royal Standard of Rohan
active_or_passive_rules.description: Banner with range 6", Gamling does not suffer the -1 penalty in the Duel roll. If a friendly Rohan Hero model within 6" spends a Might point, they may roll a D6. On a natural 6, the point of Might is free.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Defender of Edoras
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whenever Haleth is outnumbered in Combat, if he wins the Duel roll he may re-roll failed To Wound rolls.

active_or_passive_rules.name: There is Always Hope
active_or_passive_rules.description: Haleth has Attack 2 whilst he is within 6" of Aragorn.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Fight to the Last
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Haleth is engaged in combat, Aragorn and friendly Rohan Infantry models within 6" gain +1 Fight value. This ends immediately if Haleth is slain.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Doorward of Meduseld
active_or_passive_rules.description: As long as Theoden is alive and on the battlefield, Hama and any Rohan Royal Guard within 6" of him count as having the Dominant (2) special rule.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Warrior Poet
active_or_passive_rules.description: Hama may spend a Will point at the start of any Fight phase. If he does so, friendly Rohan models within 6" of him may re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1, until the end of that turn.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Horn of the Hammerhand
active_or_passive_rules.description: Once per game at start of any Move phase, Helm can blow this horn. Until the end of that turn, enemy models within 24" of Helm suffer a -1 penalty to Courage tests.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Hammerhand
active_or_passive_rules.description: Helm never counts as unarmed.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Into the Fray
active_or_passive_rules.description: Helm may declare a free Heroic Combat each Fight phase. However, after he has slain an enemy model, he must always Charge an enemy model if possible, for the rest of the battle.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Horn of the Hammerhand
active_or_passive_rules.description: Once per game at start of any Move phase, Helm can blow this horn. Until the end of that turn, enemy models within 24" of Helm suffer a -1 penalty to Courage tests.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Hammerhand
active_or_passive_rules.description: Helm never counts as unarmed.

active_or_passive_rules.name: No Longer a Leader
active_or_passive_rules.description: Helm can never be your General. He cannot call Stand Fast and models cannot benefit from his Heroic Actions.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Berserk Rage
active_or_passive_rules.description: Helm must always Charge if able to do so. When he Charges, he gains Terror until the end of the turn, and may declare a free Heroic Combat in the Fight phase.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Horn of the Hammerhand
active_or_passive_rules.description: Once per game at start of any Move phase, Helm can blow this horn. Until the end of that turn, enemy models within 24" of Helm suffer a -1 penalty to Courage tests.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Hammerhand
active_or_passive_rules.description: Helm never counts as unarmed.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Into the Fray
active_or_passive_rules.description: Helm may declare a free Heroic Combat each Fight phase. However, after he has slain an enemy model, he must always Charge an enemy model if possible, for the rest of the battle.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Spyglass
active_or_passive_rules.description: Hera may ignore the Stalk Unseen special rule of enemy models, and may draw Line of Sight to them as normal.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Daughter of Rohan
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Hera is in a 1-on-1 combat with no supporting models involved, she gains Attack 3 and may re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Fury of the Hammerhand
active_or_passive_rules.description: When Hera Charges, she must re-roll any failed To Wound rolls in that turn.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Warrior Bride
active_or_passive_rules.description: Enemy models Engaged in Combat with Hera cannot declare a Heroic Strike.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Orders from Edoras
active_or_passive_rules.description:
Lief may spend a Will point at the end of his Activation, as long as he is not Engaged in Combat, to pick one of the following orders that last until the end of the turn. Each order can only be chosen once per game.
1. Friendly Rohan Hero models within 3" can declare a free Heroic Combat.
2. Friendly Rohan models within 3" gain the Fearless special rule.
3. Friendly Rohan models with 3" do not suffer the -1 penalty To Hit when moving and shooting, and may re-roll failed To Hit rolls.
4. Friendly Rohan models that start their Activation within 3" of Lief gain Woodland Creature and Mountain Dweller.
5. Friendly Rohan models that start their Activation within 3" of Lief increase their Move value by 2".

active_or_passive_rules.name: Stalwart Fighter
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst Olwyn is outnumbered in Combat, enemy models require a 6 To Wound her, regardless of Strength. Enemy models may still use Might to influence their To Wound rolls as normal.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Arise, Riders of Rohan!
active_or_passive_rules.description: If this model is within 12" of a Rohan General and has the Cavalry keyword, it receives +1 bonus to its Fight value on a turn in which they Charge.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Spear Mastery
active_or_passive_rules.description: This model may use its throwing spears as a normal spear during the Fight phase, as long as it hasn't made a shooting attack with it in the Move or Shoot phase.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Arise, Riders of Rohan!
active_or_passive_rules.description: If this model is within 12" of a Rohan General and has the Cavalry keyword, it receives +1 bonus to its Fight value on a turn in which they Charge.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Spear Mastery
active_or_passive_rules.description: This model may use its throwing spears as a normal spear during the Fight phase, as long as it hasn't made a shooting attack with it in the Move or Shoot phase.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Herugrim
active_or_passive_rules.description: If a Combat is tied at Fight value, Theoden wins. If both sides have a similar special rule, roll off as normal.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Forth, and Fear no Darkness
active_or_passive_rules.description: Theoden's Stand Fast! Is 12" rather than 6".

active_or_passive_rules.name: The will of Men is easily corrupted
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Theoden is within 6" of Grima, Theoden is reduced to Fight 3, cannot declare Heroic Actions or spend Will points.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Reckless Charge
active_or_passive_rules.description: Theodred must Charge enemy models if able to so. Additionally, when he charges, re-roll any failed To Wound rolls in that fight.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Spear Mastery
active_or_passive_rules.description: This model may use its throwing spears as a normal spear during the Fight phase, as long as it hasn't made a shooting attack with it in the Move or Shoot phase.

active_or_passive_rules.name: For Theoden!
active_or_passive_rules.description: During the Declare Heroic Actions step of the Fight Phase, if Theoden is Engaged in Combat within 6", Deorwine may call a Heroic Combat for free. If the action is successful, you must use the following move to join Theoden's Combat, or get as close as possible to him. He cannot use this special rule if he is in the same Combat as Theoden.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Pinpoint Accuracy
active_or_passive_rules.description: Elfhelm may re-roll To Hit, To Wound and In The Way rolls when using his throwing spears, and never suffers the normal -1 penalty when moving and shooting with his throwing spears.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Keen Sight
active_or_passive_rules.description: Enemy models within 12" of Crebain do not gain the benefit of the Stalk Unseen special rule.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Cloud of Birds
active_or_passive_rules.description: Shooting attacks will only ever hit a Crebain on a natural roll of a 6.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Wormtongue
active_or_passive_rules.description: Heroic actions cast by enemy heroes within 6" cost 2 Might points, rather than 1.

active_or_passive_rules.name: A Traitor Within
active_or_passive_rules.description:
Grima can be deployed in one of two ways, though his controlling player must decide which before either Army is deployed. Grima can either be deployed as part of Saruman's Warband (in which case he will not take up a space in the Warband), or as part of the enemy Army.

If Grima chooses to be deployed as part of the enemy Army, he must select an enemy Hero. Once that Hero and their Warband has been deployed, Grima's controlling player can deploy Grima as if he was also part of that Warband, following all the usual deployment rules. Grima is still part of his controlling player's Army, and will Activate like any other model in his controlling player's Army.

If Grima is deployed as part of the enemy Army, then enemy models treat him as a friendly model, and therefore cannot shoot him, Charge him, make Strikes against him, target him with special rules, or make a shooting attack in which Grima would be In The Way. They may also ignore his Control Zone. They can, however, target him with Magical Powers like any other enemy model.

Whilst Grima is considered a friendly model, Grima may ignore the Control Zones of enemy models and may Move through enemy models as if they weren't there. When Grima Moves this way, he cannot end his Move overlapping or in base contact with an enemy model. Grima can choose to Charge an enemy model as normal if he wishes.

These restrictions immediately end if Saruman is slain, if Grima Charges an enemy model, if Grima destroys an enemy Siege Engine, or if Grima interacts with an Objective Marker (such as destroying a Supply Marker or picking up an objective), at which point Grima is treated as a normal enemy model and can be Charged, shot at and slain like any other model.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Let's put a maggot hole in your belly
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Grishnakh wins a Duel roll, and there are no other allies involved in the combat (including Supporting models), then he can choose a single 25mm enemy model he was Engaged in Combat with and roll a D6. On a 4+, that model is knocked Prone before Strikes are made.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Find the Halflings
active_or_passive_rules.description: Lurtz may choose the result of the Maelstrom of Battle special rule for his warband, rather than rolling.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Shield Throw
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Lurtz has a shield, he may use it as throwing weapon once per game with a Strength of 4. Any 25mm model hit will be knocked prone, and he may re-roll the To Hit roll. Once thrown, Lurtz will no longer carry the shield.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Oblivious to Pain
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whenever Lurtz suffers a Wound, roll a D6. On a natural 6, the Wound is ignored.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Palantir
active_or_passive_rules.description: Once per game, you may automatically win the Priority roll. Must be declared before any dice are rolled in the Priority roll.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Voice of Curunir
active_or_passive_rules.description: Saruman's Stand Fast! Range is 12", and affects Hero models.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Saruman's Deceit
active_or_passive_rules.description: Saruman can choose a single enemy Hero at the beginning of the game. That Hero will suffer a -1 penalty to any Resist tests they make against Saruman's magical powers cast upon them. However, a natural 6 will still count as a 6.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Riding Dagger
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whenever an enemy model resolves a strike against Sharku (but not his warg) and fails To Wound, Sharku may immediately make one Strength 4 Strike against that model.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Fury of the Pack
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst he has the Cavalry keyword, whenever Sharku Charges he gains Fight 5 and Attack 3 for the rest of the turn.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Cunning Mind
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Snaga benefits from the Heroic Action of another friendly Hero, he can roll a D6. On a 5+, he regains a Might point that he spent earlier in the battle. Additionally, Snaga can choose not to take part in a friendly Hero model's Heroic Action, and Activate as normal.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Head Taker
active_or_passive_rules.description: If his army is Broken, instead of taking a Courage test, Ugluk can kill a friendly Warrior within 2" to pass the test, with a Stand Fast Range of 12" that affects both Warrior and Hero models.

active_or_passive_rules.name: "Looks like meat's back on the menu, boys!"
active_or_passive_rules.description: Upon Activation, Ugluk can kill a friendly Orc Warrior within 2" of him. All friendly Uruk-hai within 6" gain Fearless, and +1 To Wound until the end of that turn. If Ugluk does this when the army is Broken, it will also count as triggering the Head Taker rule above.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Berserker Blade
active_or_passive_rules.description: A hand-and-a-half weapon. If using as a two-handed weapon, the berserker can make a single Strike against every enemy model they were Engaged in Combat with.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Oblivious to Pain
active_or_passive_rules.description: When the berserker suffers a Wound, roll a D6. On a 6, the Wound is ignored.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Bloodoath
active_or_passive_rules.description: Friendly Dunland models within 6" of the Oathmaker gain the Fearless special rule.

active_or_passive_rules.name: "We will die for Saruman"
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst Saruman is alive on the battlefield, the Oathmaker and friendly Dunland models must re-roll To Wounds rolls of a natural 1 when making strikes.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Flaming Brand
active_or_passive_rules.description: A model with a Flaming Brand has the Terror (Cavalry) and Terror (Beast) special rules. Additionally, this model will then count as 2 models rather than 1 when working out how many models are within range of an objective marker.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Moving the Charge
active_or_passive_rules.description: The charge is moved in the same manner as a Heavy Object, on a 25mm base.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Demolition Charges
active_or_passive_rules.description: A model with a torch can attempt to detonate the charge in the Fight phase, if they in base contact and not Engaged in Combat. See pg.169 of Armies of LOTR book for full details.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Attacking the Charge
active_or_passive_rules.description: The charge has Defence 7 and Wounds 3. Charge can potentially go off when it takes a Wound.  Charge can also be disabled by an enemy model who has only moved into base contact with it that turn. See pg.169 of Armies of LOTR book for full details.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Berserker Blade
active_or_passive_rules.description: A hand-and-a-half weapon. If using as a two-handed weapon, the berserker can make a single Strike against every enemy model they were Engaged in Combat with.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Oblivious to Pain
active_or_passive_rules.description: When the berserker suffers a Wound, roll a D6. On a 6, the Wound is ignored.

additional_text: Crewed by two Uruk-Hai Engineers, one Uruk-Hai Berserker with torch, and one demolition charge.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Acurate
active_or_passive_rules.description: An Assault Ballista will only scatter 3" rather than 6"

active_or_passive_rules.name: Piercing Shot
active_or_passive_rules.description: A model hit will be flung back D6" if it has a Strength of 5 or lower. Any models passed over are knocked prone and take a Strength 5 hit. The flung model stops if it hits impassable terrain or a model with Strength 6 or higher, and both take a Strength 6 hit. The flung model is knocked prone if it survives. If the flung model would end its movement over other models, those models are moved the minimum distance to allow the flung model to be placed.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Raise the Ladders!
active_or_passive_rules.description: An Isengard Assault Ballista can be used to raise a ladder onto enemy battlements in a siege game. Choose a point on the battlements within range and roll to hit. If successful, place a ladder within 6" of the wall base below the target point against the battlements. A model that was carrying the ladder can be placed at the top and will count as charging if there is a defender there. If not, the model can move normally.

additional_text: Crewed by three Uruk-Hai Siege Crew, one of which is the Siege Veteran.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Pack Master
active_or_passive_rules.description: Once separated from Azog, only Warg models may benefit from the White Warg's Stand Fast And benefit from its Heroic Actions.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Trample
active_or_passive_rules.description: When a Troll Brute Tramples, it will inflict 2 Strength 10 hits.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Rapid-fire Bolt Thrower
active_or_passive_rules.description: A crossbow that fires D6 shots per turn. Only has a limited field of fire 45 degrees to its left or right (can be measured by placing Chariot Pivot Template with the X over the bolt thrower and dotted line running down the wooden shaft connecting the goats). This chariot may move and shoot without any -1 penalty. Can also shoot when Engaged in Combat, with no In The Way tests for models it is in Combat with.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Chariot Charge
active_or_passive_rules.description: When moving via Chariot Charge, the Chariot will inflict 3 Strength 6 hits.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Dwarven Crew
active_or_passive_rules.description: Any Iron Hills Warrior that ends their Activation in base contact may join its crew. That Warrior is removed as a casualty and then the chariot immediately regains a Wound lost earlier in the battle.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Swift Gallop
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst mounted on Ashere, and when Hera activates, she can choose to gain Move 12" and Woodland Creature until the end of her activation, but cannot Charge during this move.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Faithful Servant
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst mounted on Snowmane, Theoden may re-roll failed Courage tests when charging an enemy with Terror.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Faithful Servant
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst mounted on Snowmane, Theoden may re-roll failed Courage tests when charging an enemy with Terror.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Sure-footed Steed
active_or_passive_rules.description: If the rider is knocked prone whilst riding Brego, and Brego isn't killed, they can roll a D6. On a 6, the rider stays mounted and isn't knocked prone. They can use Might to improve this roll.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Gandalf's Rockets
active_or_passive_rules.description: In every Shoot phase, Gandalf can shoot a firework at an enemy in Line of Sight and within 6", even if Engaged in Combat. No In The Way rolls are required for this special rule. There are four different fireworks to choose from - see pg.12 of Armies of LOTR book for the full details.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Feral
active_or_passive_rules.description: Will always flee when separated.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Feral
active_or_passive_rules.description: Will always flee when separated.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Lord of the Mearas
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst mounted upon Shadowfax, Gandalf rolls two dice and picks for the highest for Jump, Leap and Swim tests. Also, Shadowfax only halves his Move value in difficult terrain, rather than quartering it.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Devastating Charge
active_or_passive_rules.description: When this model Charges against one or more 25mm models, roll a D6 for each. On a 5+, that model is immediately knocked Prone.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Majestic Steed
active_or_passive_rules.description: In a turn in which Thranduil Charges into Combat, he resolves his Strikes at Strength 5. Additionally, each time this model Charges into Combat, it will inflict a single Strength 4 hit upon one model it has Charged (Cavalry models suffer this hit on both the rider and the Mount). If after this hit Thranduil is no longer Engaged in Combat, he may continue his Move in any way his controlling player wishes; stopping straight away, Charging another enemy model, or anything in between.

additional_text: If Radagast dismounts from the Great Eagle, it will automatically pass its Courage test for being a Separated Mount.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Chariot Charge
active_or_passive_rules.description: When Radagast's Sleigh Moves via Chariot Charge, it will inflict 2 Strength 4 Impact hits.

additional_text: If Radagast dismounts from his Sleigh, it must be removed from play.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Ring of Barahir
active_or_passive_rules.description: When affected by a Magical Power, and after any resist tests, Aragorn may roll a D6. On a 6, he is not affected by that power.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Anduril, Flame of the West
active_or_passive_rules.description: Elven hand-and-a-half weapon, never needs more than a 4+ To Wound, or a 3+ if using Anduril as a two-handed weapon.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Barliman Butterbur, At Your Service
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Barliman finishes his Move in base contact with a friendly Fellowship model, he may spend a Will point to roll a D6. On a 4+, that friendly model regains a lost Wound.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Well fed, and ready to fight
active_or_passive_rules.description: Friendly Fellowship models within 6" of Barliman count as having the Dominant (2) special rule.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Deep-rooted Hatred
active_or_passive_rules.description: Must re-roll failed To Wound rolls against Orc, Uruk-hai, Goblin or Isengard models. Additionally, he must always charge these types of models if able to do so.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Bludgeon
active_or_passive_rules.description: Choose one enemy model as a bludgeon, and another model as the target. Both suffer a S8 hit. If the bludgeon is slain, you may keep repeating this until the bludgeon is not slain (in which case that model is knocked Prone). The bludgeon cannot be a Monster, Chariot or War Beast. If the bludgeon is a Cavalry model, then the rider is picked up and separated from their mount.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Mithril Coat
active_or_passive_rules.description: A piece of Mithril armour, additionally Bilbo may re-roll Fate rolls of a 1.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Sting
active_or_passive_rules.description: An Elven hand weapon, Bilbo gains +1 Strength when making strikes with Sting.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Slip Away
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst wearing the One Ring and Invisible, enemy models Engaged in Combat with Bilbo must halve their Fight value.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Official Meals
active_or_passive_rules.description: Fellowship models treat Bill as a banner.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Second Breakfast
active_or_passive_rules.description: A Fellowship model who ends their Activation in base contact with Bill can roll a D6. On a 5+, they may restore 1 point of Might, Will or Fate spent earlier in the battle. Only one model can use this rule each turn.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Only a Pony
active_or_passive_rules.description: Bill never provides a Stand Fast. However, he can benefit from any Fellowship hero's Stand Fast.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Naturally Unhasty
active_or_passive_rules.description: Birchseed gets a free Heroic Move in the Move Phase of any turn in which the opposing player won Priority and chose to have Priority themselves that turn.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Bludgeon
active_or_passive_rules.description: Choose one enemy model as a bludgeon, and another model as the target. Both suffer a S8 hit. If the bludgeon is slain, you may keep repeating this until the bludgeon is not slain (in which case that model is knocked Prone). The bludgeon cannot be a Monster, Chariot or War Beast. If the bludgeon is a Cavalry model, then the rider is picked up and separated from their mount.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Horn of Gondor
active_or_passive_rules.description: A war horn, where if Boromir is outnumbered in a Combat, you may ask your opponent to choose one of their models involved, who must take a Courage test. If they fail, Boromir wins the Duel roll.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Protect the little ones!
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst within 3" of friendly Fellowship Hobbit models, Boromir gains Fearless, and may re-roll failed To Wound rolls when making Strikes.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Bludgeon
active_or_passive_rules.description: Choose one enemy model as a bludgeon, and another model as the target. Both suffer a S8 hit. If the bludgeon is slain, you may keep repeating this until the bludgeon is not slain (in which case that model is knocked Prone). The bludgeon cannot be a Monster, Chariot or War Beast. If the bludgeon is a Cavalry model, then the rider is picked up and separated from their mount.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Get out of my fields!
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst within range of an Objective Marker, Farmer Maggot does not suffer the -1 penalty to his Duel rolls for using a two-handed weapon.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Mithril Coat
active_or_passive_rules.description: A piece of Mithril armour, additionally Frodo may re-roll Fate rolls of a 1.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Sting
active_or_passive_rules.description: An Elven hand weapon, Frodo gains +1 Strength when making strikes with Sting.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Glamdring
active_or_passive_rules.description: Elven hand-and-a-half weapon. Gandalf's strength is 5 when making strikes with Glamdring.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Narya
active_or_passive_rules.description: Gandalf may re-roll any failed Fate rolls.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Axes of the Dwarves!
active_or_passive_rules.description: At the beginning of a Combat, Gimli can choose either his two-handed axe, or an axe in each hand which gives him an Attack value of 3.

active_or_passive_rules.name: "I myself am sitting pretty on 43"
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Gimli has fewer kills than Legolas, he gets +1 bonus on To Wound rolls when making Strikes.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Loyal Hounds
active_or_passive_rules.description: Grip, Fang and Wolf will always use Farmer Maggot's Courage value whilst he is alive on the battlefield. Additionally, they treat Farmer Maggot as a banner with range 6", and may re-roll failed To Wound rolls whilst within 6" of him.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Windlord
active_or_passive_rules.description: Only Eagle and Wizard models may benefit from Gwaihir's Stand Fast or benefit from his Heroic Actions.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Leave my Flowers Alone!
active_or_passive_rules.description: At the start of the game after deployments, Hamfast's player places three 25mm Flower Markers anywhere on the board. Models can Move over them but cannot end their move or back away onto them. Objects cannot be placed overlapping them. Friendly Hobbits re-roll failed To Wound rolls for Strikes and shooting whilst within 3" of a Flower Marker. Hamfast also gains +1 To Wound when making Strikes or shooting an enemy within 3" of a Flower Marker.

active_or_passive_rules.name: "Final Count, 42"
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Legolas has fewer kills than Gimli, he gains +1 To Wound on shooting attacks.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Dead Shot
active_or_passive_rules.description: Legolas can make three shooting attacks during the Shoot Phase. He can still shoot whilst Engaged in Combat, and does not suffer the -1 penalty To Hit for Moving and Shooting, as long as he has the Infantry keyword. He can also shoot at models he in Engaged in Combat with, requiring no In The Way tests.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Pinpoint Shot
active_or_passive_rules.description: Legolas can make a single shot against an enemy Engaged in Combat with himself or a friendly model. If the To Hit roll is successful, he doesn't need to make any In The Way rolls.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Umbrella
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Lobelia wins a Combat, she may not make Strikes.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Furious Tirade
active_or_passive_rules.description: Enemy Warrior models from may not benefit from a Hero model's Stand Fast whilst within 6" of Lobelia.

active_or_passive_rules.name: A Stern Scolding
active_or_passive_rules.description: Once per turn during her Activation, Lobelia can spend a Will point, and choose an enemy model within 6" and Line of Sight. Roll a D6, and on a 2+, that model cannot Activate this turn. Also, their Attack is reduced to 1 in any Combat. Does not affect Monster, Chariot or War Beast models.

active_or_passive_rules.name: For the Shire!
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Merry is within 3" of Boromir of Gondor, Merry may spend his Might points as if they were his own.

active_or_passive_rules.name: For the Shire!
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Pippin is within 3" of Boromir of Gondor, Merry may spend his Might points as if they were his own.

active_or_passive_rules.name: If I were to marry anyone, it would've been her
active_or_passive_rules.description: Whilst Sam is within 3" of Rosie, he may re-roll any failed To Wound rolls when making strikes.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Sweet Maiden of the Golden Ale
active_or_passive_rules.description: Rosie is a banner of range 6" for friendly Hobbit models. She also counts as a banner towards Scenario Victory Points, as long as she is alive.

active_or_passive_rules.name: "Let him go or I'll have you, Longshanks!"
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Frodo is Engaged in a Fight within 6" of Sam, then Sam may call a Heroic Combat for free. If the action is successful, Sam must use the following move to join Frodo's combat, or move as close as possible to Frodo.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Frying Pan
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Sam wins a Duel Roll, he may choose to use his frying pan instead of making Strike. Choose one enemy Infantry model in the Combat (but not a Monster) and roll a D6. On a 4+, that model is stunned and cannot Move the following turn.

active_or_passive_rules.name: "Serve the Master of the Precious"
active_or_passive_rules.description: Smeagol's Courage value is 5+ whilst within 6" of Frodo.

active_or_passive_rules.name: "Soft and quick and shadows we must be"
active_or_passive_rules.description: Smeagol does not halve his Move value when moving through Difficult Terrain. Additionally, if Frodo or Sam begin their Activation within 6" of Smeagol, they will also benefit from this special rule.

active_or_passive_rules.name: A Light in the Dark
active_or_passive_rules.description: The area within 6" of the Gatekeeper is always considered to be daylight. Additionally, enemy models cannot Charge friendly models if they can charge the Gatekeeper instead.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Gatekeeper
active_or_passive_rules.description: After Priority has been rolled, the Gatekeeper may spent a Will point and choose one enemy Infantry model within 6" and in Line of Sight, and roll a D6. On a 3+, that model cannot Move that during their Activation, but may perform any other action as normal. Does not affect Monster models.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Merry & Pippin
active_or_passive_rules.description: Can ride as passengers and not be targeted by enemy attacks and shooting. Treebeard gains Resistant to Magic if one of them remains mounted. May use their Throw Stones rule without a -1 penalty for moving - see pg.24 of Armies of LOTR book for full details.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Bludgeon
active_or_passive_rules.description: Choose one enemy model as a bludgeon, and another model as the target. Both suffer a S8 hit. If the bludgeon is slain, you may keep repeating this until the bludgeon is not slain (in which case that model is knocked Prone). The bludgeon cannot be a Monster, Chariot or War Beast. If the bludgeon is a Cavalry model, then the rider is picked up and separated from their mount.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Skin-changer
active_or_passive_rules.description: At the start of his Activation, Beorn can change his form from Man to Bear. If he does, place the Bear model in base contact with the Man model, and then remove the Man model from play. If there is no space to place the Bear model, then Beorn cannot transform. Once he has transformed, Beorn the Bear may continue his Activation as normal, including Charging in which case check the Line of Sight from the newly placed Bear model to determine whether Beorn can Charge. Once Beorn has transformed, he uses the Beorn the Bear profile - though his Wounds, Might, Will and Fate Points remain the same between both profiles.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Berserk
active_or_passive_rules.description: When Beorn the Bear begins his Activation, he must check to see if he can Charge an enemy model. If he can then he may not change form during this Activation and he must Charge an enemy model if possible. Additionally, Beorn the Bear may not benefit from the Heroic Actions of other friendly models, with the exception of friendly Bear models, and friendly models may not benefit from the Heroic Actions or Stand Fast of Beorn unless they have the Beorning keyword.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Crushing Strength
active_or_passive_rules.description: If Beorn wins a Duel Roll he can choose to use this Brutal Power Attack. If he does, choose a single enemy model involved in the Combat. The chosen model immediately suffers a Strength 10 hit. If the To Wound Roll is successful (even if the Wound is prevented), the model immediately suffers another Strength 10 hit, and so on until either Beorn fails a To Wound Roll, or the chosen model is slain and removed as a casualty.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Skin-changer
active_or_passive_rules.description: At the start of his Activation, Beorn can change his form from Man to Bear. If he does, place the Bear model in base contact with the Man model, and then remove the Man model from play. If there is no space to place the Bear model, then Beorn cannot transform. Once he has transformed, Beorn the Bear may continue his Activation as normal, including Charging in which case check the Line of Sight from the newly placed Bear model to determine whether Beorn can Charge. Once Beorn has transformed, he uses the Beorn the Bear profile - though his Wounds, Might, Will and Fate Points remain the same between both profiles.

active_or_passive_rules.name: Nenya
active_or_passive_rules.description: Galadriel may re-roll any failed Fate rolls.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Light of Earendil
active_or_passive_rules.description: At any point during her Activation, Galadriel can roll a D6. On a 3+, she counts as having cast the Blinding Light Magical Power. This does not prevent her from casting another Magical Power during her Activation.

active_or_passive_rules.name: The Lady of Lorien
active_or_passive_rules.description: Galadriel gains a free Will point at the start of each turn. If it is not spent by the end of the turn, then it is lost.

active_or_passive_rules.name: War Aspect
active_or_passive_rules.description: Enemies within 6" of Galadriel suffer a -1 penalty to any Courage tests. Additionally, Galadriel never counts as Unarmed.

active_or_passive_rules.name: "Go back to the void, from whence you came!"
active_or_passive_rules.description: Galadriel may target any enemy with Banishment as if it were a Spirit model, though non-Spirit models targeted will gain an extra free Will point to their Resist test. Once per game instead of casting a Magical Power, as long as she has at least 1 Will point, she may choose an enemy within 6", who immediately suffers D3 Wounds.
